verses.text: And it was \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, Behold, the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w weepeth|strong="H1058"\w* and \w mourneth|strong="H0056"\w* for \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.

And the \w victory|strong="H8668"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* was \add turned\add* into \w mourning|strong="H0060"\w* unto all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*: for the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* \w say|strong="H0559"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* how the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* was \w grieved|strong="H6087"\w* for his \w son|strong="H1121"\w*.\f + \fr 19.2 \ft victory: Heb. salvation, or, deliverance\f*

And the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w gat|strong="H0935"\w* them by \w stealth|strong="H1589"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, as \w people|strong="H5971"\w* being \w ashamed|strong="H3637"\w* steal \w away|strong="H1589"\w* when they \w flee|strong="H5127"\w* in \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*.

But the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w covered|strong="H3813"\w* his \w face|strong="H6440"\w*, and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w cried|strong="H2199"\w* with a \w loud|strong="H1419"\w* \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, O my \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, O \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*!

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Thou hast \w shamed|strong="H3001"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* the \w faces|strong="H6440"\w* of all thy \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, which this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* have \w saved|strong="H4422"\w* thy \w life|strong="H5315"\w*, and the \w lives|strong="H5315"\w* of thy \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* and of thy \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w*, and the \w lives|strong="H5315"\w* of thy \w wives|strong="H0802"\w*, and the \w lives|strong="H5315"\w* of thy \w concubines|strong="H6370"\w*;

In that thou \w lovest|strong="H0157"\w* thine \w enemies|strong="H8130"\w*, and \w hatest|strong="H8130"\w* thy \w friends|strong="H0157"\w*. For thou hast \w declared|strong="H5046"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, that thou regardest neither \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* nor \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*: for this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* I \w perceive|strong="H3045"\w*, that \w if|strong="H3863"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* had \w lived|strong="H2416"\w*, and all we had \w died|strong="H4191"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, then it had pleased thee \w well|strong="H3477"\w*.\f + \fr 19.6 \ft In…: Heb. By loving, etc\f*\f + \fr 19.6 \ft that thou regardest…: Heb. that princes or servants are not to thee\f*

Now therefore \w arise|strong="H6965"\w*, go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*, and \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* \w comfortably|strong="H3820"\w* unto thy \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*: for I \w swear|strong="H7650"\w* by the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, if thou go not \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*, there will not \w tarry|strong="H3885"\w* \w one|strong="H0376"\w* with thee this \w night|strong="H3915"\w*: and that will be \w worse|strong="H7489"\w* unto thee than all the \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* that \w befell|strong="H0935"\w* thee from thy \w youth|strong="H5271"\w* until now.\f + \fr 19.7 \ft comfortably…: Heb. to the heart of thy servants\f*

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*. And they \w told|strong="H5046"\w* unto all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, Behold, the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* doth \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*. And all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: for \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* had \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* to his \w tent|strong="H0168"\w*.

¶ And all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* were at \w strife|strong="H1777"\w* throughout all the \w tribes|strong="H7626"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, The \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w saved|strong="H5337"\w* us out of the \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* of our \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, and he \w delivered|strong="H4422"\w* us out of the \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w*; and now he is \w fled|strong="H1272"\w* out of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* for \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, whom we \w anointed|strong="H4886"\w* over us, is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* in \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*. Now therefore why \w speak|strong="H2790"\w* ye not a word of \w bringing|strong="H7725"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w back|strong="H7725"\w*?\f + \fr 19.10 \ft speak…: Heb. are ye silent?\f*

¶ And \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* and to \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w* the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, Why are ye the \w last|strong="H0314"\w* to \w bring|strong="H7725"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w back|strong="H7725"\w* to his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*? seeing the \w speech|strong="H1697"\w* of all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* is \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, \add even\add* to his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

Ye \add are\add* my \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w*, ye \add are\add* my \w bones|strong="H6106"\w* and my \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w*: wherefore then are ye the \w last|strong="H0314"\w* to bring \w back|strong="H7725"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*?

And \w say|strong="H0559"\w* ye to \w Amasa|strong="H6021"\w*, \add Art\add* thou not of my \w bone|strong="H6106"\w*, and of my \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w*? \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w do|strong="H6213"\w* so to me, and \w more|strong="H3254"\w* also, if thou be not \w captain|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me \w continually|strong="H3117"\w* in the \w room|strong="H8478"\w* of \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*.

And he \w bowed|strong="H5186"\w* the \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* of all the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, even as \add the heart of\add* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*; so that they \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \add this word\add* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, \w Return|strong="H7725"\w* thou, and all thy \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*.

So the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w returned|strong="H7725"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*. And \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Gilgal|strong="H1537"\w*, to \w go|strong="H3212"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, to \w conduct|strong="H5674"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*.

¶ And \w Shimei|strong="H8096"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Gera|strong="H1617"\w*, a \w Benjamite|strong="H1145"\w*, which \add was\add* of \w Bahurim|strong="H0980"\w*, \w hasted|strong="H4116"\w* and came \w down|strong="H3381"\w* with the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*.

And \add there were\add* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Benjamin|strong="H1145"\w* with him, and \w Ziba|strong="H6717"\w* the \w servant|strong="H5288"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, and his \w fifteen|strong="H2568"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* and his \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* with him; and they went \w over|strong="H6743"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

And there went \w over|strong="H5674"\w* a ferry \w boat|strong="H5679"\w* to carry \w over|strong="H5674"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w household|strong="H1004"\w*, and to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* what he \w thought|strong="H5869"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*. And \w Shimei|strong="H8096"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Gera|strong="H1617"\w* fell \w down|strong="H5307"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, as he was come \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*;\f + \fr 19.18 \ft what…: Heb. the good in his eyes\f*

And \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Let not my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* \w impute|strong="H2803"\w* \w iniquity|strong="H5771"\w* unto me, neither do thou \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* that which thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* did \w perversely|strong="H5753"\w* the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* that my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* should \w take|strong="H7760"\w* it to his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*.

For thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* doth \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that I have \w sinned|strong="H2398"\w*: therefore, behold, I am \w come|strong="H0935"\w* the \w first|strong="H7223"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of all the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Joseph|strong="H3130"\w* to go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

But \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zeruiah|strong="H6870"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Shall not \w Shimei|strong="H8096"\w* be put to \w death|strong="H4191"\w* for this, because he \w cursed|strong="H7043"\w* the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w anointed|strong="H4899"\w*?

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, What have I to do with you, ye \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zeruiah|strong="H6870"\w*, that ye should this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* be \w adversaries|strong="H7854"\w* unto me? shall there any \w man|strong="H0376"\w* be put to \w death|strong="H4191"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*? for do not I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that I \add am\add* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* over \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*?

Therefore the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Shimei|strong="H8096"\w*, Thou shalt not \w die|strong="H4191"\w*. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w sware|strong="H7650"\w* unto him.

¶ And \w Mephibosheth|strong="H4648"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* came \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and had \w neither|strong="H3808"\w* \w dressed|strong="H6213"\w* his \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*, nor \w trimmed|strong="H6213"\w* his \w beard|strong="H8222"\w*, nor \w washed|strong="H3526"\w* his \w clothes|strong="H0899"\w*, from the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w departed|strong="H3212"\w* until the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* he \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \add again\add* in \w peace|strong="H7965"\w*.

And it came to pass, when he was \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Wherefore \w wentest|strong="H1980"\w* not thou with me, \w Mephibosheth|strong="H4648"\w*?

And he \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, My \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, my \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w deceived|strong="H7411"\w* me: for thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I will \w saddle|strong="H2280"\w* me an \w ass|strong="H2543"\w*, that I may \w ride|strong="H7392"\w* thereon, and \w go|strong="H3212"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; because thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \add is\add* \w lame|strong="H6455"\w*.

And he hath \w slandered|strong="H7270"\w* thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* unto my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; but my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add is\add* as an \w angel|strong="H4397"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: \w do|strong="H6213"\w* therefore \add what is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* in thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*.

For all \add of\add* my \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* were \w but|strong="H3808"\w* \w dead|strong="H4194"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* before my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: yet didst thou \w set|strong="H7896"\w* thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* among them that did \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* at thine own \w table|strong="H7979"\w*. What \w right|strong="H6666"\w* therefore \w have|strong="H3426"\w* I yet to \w cry|strong="H2199"\w* any more unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*?\f + \fr 19.28 \ft dead…: Heb. men of death\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Why \w speakest|strong="H1696"\w* thou any more of thy \w matters|strong="H1697"\w*? I have \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Thou and \w Ziba|strong="H6717"\w* \w divide|strong="H2505"\w* the \w land|strong="H7704"\w*.

And \w Mephibosheth|strong="H4648"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Yea, let him \w take|strong="H3947"\w* all, \w forasmuch|strong="H0310"\w* \w as|strong="H0834"\w* my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* is come \w again|strong="H0935"\w* in \w peace|strong="H7965"\w* unto his own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

¶ And \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w* the \w Gileadite|strong="H1569"\w* came \w down|strong="H3381"\w* from \w Rogelim|strong="H7274"\w*, and went \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w* with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, to \w conduct|strong="H7971"\w* him over \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*.

Now \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w* was a \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w aged|strong="H2204"\w* man, \add even\add* \w fourscore|strong="H8084"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w*: and he had provided the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w sustenance|strong="H3557"\w* while he \w lay|strong="H7871"\w* at \w Mahanaim|strong="H4266"\w*; for he \add was\add* a \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w*, Come thou \w over|strong="H5674"\w* with me, and I will \w feed|strong="H3557"\w* thee with me in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

And \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, How \w long|strong="H3117"\w* have I to \w live|strong="H8141"\w*, that I should go \w up|strong="H5927"\w* with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* unto \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*?\f + \fr 19.34 \ft How…: Heb. How many days are the years of my life\f*

I \add am\add* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w fourscore|strong="H8084"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w*: \add and\add* can I \w discern|strong="H3045"\w* between \w good|strong="H2896"\w* and \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*? can thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w taste|strong="H2938"\w* \w what|strong="H0834"\w* I \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* or \w what|strong="H0834"\w* I \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*? can I \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* any more the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of singing \w men|strong="H7891"\w* and singing \w women|strong="H7891"\w*? wherefore then should thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* be yet a \w burden|strong="H4853"\w* unto my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*?

Thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* will \w go|strong="H5674"\w* a little \w way|strong="H4592"\w* \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w* with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: and why should the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w recompense|strong="H1580"\w* it me with such a \w reward|strong="H1578"\w*?

Let thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*, I pray thee, turn back \w again|strong="H7725"\w*, that I may \w die|strong="H4191"\w* in mine own \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, \add and be buried\add* by the \w grave|strong="H6913"\w* of my \w father|strong="H0001"\w* and of my \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*. But behold thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Chimham|strong="H3643"\w*; let him go \w over|strong="H5674"\w* with my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; and \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to him what shall seem \w good|strong="H2896"\w* unto thee.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Chimham|strong="H3643"\w* shall \w go|strong="H5674"\w* over with me, and I will \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to him that which shall seem \w good|strong="H2896"\w* unto thee: and whatsoever thou shalt \w require|strong="H0977"\w* of me, \add that\add* will I \w do|strong="H6213"\w* for thee.\f + \fr 19.38 \ft require: Heb. choose\f*

And all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* went \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*. And when the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* was come \w over|strong="H5674"\w*, the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w kissed|strong="H5401"\w* \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w*, and \w blessed|strong="H1288"\w* him; and he \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* unto his own \w place|strong="H4725"\w*.

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* went \w on|strong="H5674"\w* to \w Gilgal|strong="H1537"\w*, and \w Chimham|strong="H3643"\w* went \w on|strong="H5674"\w* with him: and all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w conducted|strong="H5674"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and also \w half|strong="H2677"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.\f + \fr 19.40 \ft Chimham: Heb. Chimhan\f*

¶ And, behold, all the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Why have our \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w* the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* stolen thee \w away|strong="H1589"\w*, and have \w brought|strong="H5674"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and his \w household|strong="H1004"\w*, and all \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* with him, over \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*?

And all the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, Because the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add is\add* near of \w kin|strong="H7138"\w* to us: wherefore then be ye \w angry|strong="H2734"\w* for this \w matter|strong="H1697"\w*? have we \w eaten|strong="H0398"\w* at \w all|strong="H0398"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \add cost\add*? or hath he \w given|strong="H5375"\w* us any \w gift|strong="H5379"\w*?

And the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, We have \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w parts|strong="H3027"\w* in the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w we|strong="H0589"\w* have also more \add right\add* in \w David|strong="H1732"\w* than ye: why then did ye \w despise|strong="H7043"\w* us, that our \w advice|strong="H1697"\w* should not be \w first|strong="H7223"\w* had in bringing \w back|strong="H7725"\w* our \w king|strong="H4428"\w*? And the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* were \w fiercer|strong="H7185"\w* than the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.\f + \fr 19.43 \ft despise…: Heb. set us at light\f*
